Detailed Description

Class FactoredNumber may be used to represent the prime factorization of a given natural number n, n >= 1.

The class uses two private member fields to store the primes which divide n, in ascending order, and the corresponding exponents. This implementation assumes that n has only "small" prime factors, i.e., only prime factors which appear in a SINGULAR-internal array of primes that can be accessed via the method cf_getSmallPrime(int).
The class FactoredNumber implements basic operations between natural numbers such as gcd, lcm, *, check for divisibility and cancelation of prime factors (given by a second instance of FactoredNumber).

Author:
Frank Seelisch, http://www.mathematik.uni-kl.de/~seelisch

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

FactoredNumber::FactoredNumber ( const int  n  ) 

A constructor which expects a natural number n, n >= 1, which has only "small" primes in its prime factorization. The parameter n will be prime-factorized by this constructor to fill the private members accordingly.
(For all n < 1, a representation of 1 will be returned.)

Parameters:
n the natural number to be represented, n >= 1

FactoredNumber::FactoredNumber ( const int  p,
const int  exponent 
)

A constructor which expects "small" prime and some exponent >= 0. The resulting instance represents the natural number p^exponent. In the case exponent == 0, this number will be 1.

Parameters:
p a "small" prime
exponent the exponent for p

FactoredNumber::FactoredNumber ( const FactoredNumber &  fn  ) 

The copy constructor. This creates a deep copy of the given argument.

Parameters:
fn a reference to some FactoredNumber

The destructor.

Member Function Documentation

FactoredNumber FactoredNumber::cancel ( const FactoredNumber &  fn  )  const

A method for computing the cancelation of the FactoredNumber given by *this with respect to the argument. The result is a new instance of FactoredNumber which is defined as follows: Let p^e be the highest p-power in *this. Then
(1) If p does not appear in fn, then p^e is also the highest p-power in the result.
(2) Let p^d be the highest p-power in fn.
(2.1) If e > d then p^(e-d) is the highest p-power in the result.
(2.2) If e <= d then p does not appear in the result.

Parameters:
fn a reference to some FactoredNumber
Returns:
the cancelation of *this w.r.t. fn

bool FactoredNumber::divides ( const FactoredNumber &  fn  )  const

A method for checking whether the FactoredNumber given by *this divides the argument.

Parameters:
fn a reference to some FactoredNumber
Returns:
true iff *this divides fn

FactoredNumber FactoredNumber::factorial ( int  nn,
int *  n 
) [static]

A static method for computing the factorial of a given multi-index of natural numbers. The result is a new instance of FactoredNumber which represents the natural number n[0]! * n[1]! * ... * n[nn-1]!.
nn is assumed to be at least 1.

Parameters:
nn the number of indices in the multi-index
n the multi-index
Returns:
the factorial of the multi-index given by n

FactoredNumber FactoredNumber::gcd ( const FactoredNumber &  fn  )  const

A method for computing the greatest common divisor (gcd) of the FactoredNumber given by *this and the argument. The result is a new instance of FactoredNumber.

Parameters:
fn a reference to some FactoredNumber
Returns:
the gcd of *this and fn

int FactoredNumber::getExponent ( const int  p  )  const

A method for obtaining the exponent with which a given prime appears in the FactoredNumber given by *this. If the prime is not present, then the correct exponent 0 is returned.

Parameters:
p the prime
Returns:
the exponent of p in *this

int FactoredNumber::getInt (  )  const

A method for obtaining the integer value of the FactoredNumber given by *this. This method may encounter overflows; hence the result may be incorrect.

Returns:
the integer value of *this

int FactoredNumber::getSmallestP (  )  const

A method for obtaining the smallest prime sitting inside the FactoredNumber given by *this. If there is no prime, then this method returns 1.

Returns:
the smallest prime in *this, or 1 if there is none

static void FactoredNumber::insertPrime ( std::list< int > &  primes,
std::list< int > &  exponents,
const int  p 
) [static, private]

A static method for inserting a prime into the list m_primes. This will work regardless whether p is already present in m_primes or not. The exponent corresponding to p will be set/adjusted accordingly.

Parameters:
primes a list of prime numbers
exponents a list of corresponding exponents
p the prime to be inserted

int FactoredNumber::power ( const int  b,
const int  e 
) [static, private]

A static method for computing the power b^e, for given ints b >= 1 and e >= 0. This method goes along the binary representation of e, thus only computing the necessary powers b^1, b^2, b^4, b^8, etc.

Parameters:
b the base of the power to be computed
e the exponent of the power to be computed
Returns:
the power b^e

void FactoredNumber::print (  )  const

A method for printing a string representation of the FactoredNumber given by *this.

void FactoredNumber::printLn (  )  const

A method for printing a string representation of the FactoredNumber given by *this, followed by a line feed.

int FactoredNumber::smarandache (  )  const

A method for computing the value of the Smarandache function for the FactoredNumber given by *this. For an integer n, n >= 1, the Smarandache function yields the smallest natural number k such that n divies k!.

Returns:
the value of the Smarandache function applied to *this

char * FactoredNumber::toString (  )  const

A method for obtaining a printable string representation of the FactoredNumber given by *this. The caller of this method is responsible for deleting the obtained char*.

Returns:
a string representation of *this

Member Data Documentation

std::list<int> FactoredNumber::m_exponents [private]

private store for the exponents with which the primes appear in the prime factorization of the represented natural number; the exponent at position k corresponds to the k-th prime stored in m_primes

std::list<int> FactoredNumber::m_primes [private]

private store for all primes appearing in the prime factorization of the represented natural number; the primes are stored in ascending order
